page.title: 06SCAMPTON FARMS 50 YEARS AGO
page.content: Fifty years ago all the land was owned by the Church Commissioner's. People rented small pieces of land. Hay and corn was cut with a scythe then reapers pulled by horses cut the rest. Three horses drew binders. Shire and Clydesdale horses worked for two hours and then were fed and rested. Sheaves were made into stooks. Then horses and carts took the corn to the stack yard where it was thatched. After being put in stacks the corn was thershed. Threshing machines travelled from farm to farm. Farms were mixed arable and stock consisting of sheep, cattle and horses. Large hedges divided fields. Large fields might be 22 acres. Fourteen people worked at manor farm which was 350 acres.
